definition: towards/to face/to turn towards/direction/to support/to side with/shortly before/formerly/always/all along/(suffix) suitable for .../oriented to ...
to tend toward/to guide/variant of 向[xiang4]
variant of 向[xiang4]/direction/orientation/to face/to turn toward/to/towards/shortly before/formerly

sentences.english: The way of public management of sexuality perhaps will shift from mopping up to regulation.
sentences.chinese: 性的公共管理学路向，将可能从扫荡走向管理。

sentences.english: Where do things stand in the fight to raise the debt ceiling?
sentences.chinese: 提高债务上限之争，路向何方？

sentences.english: Part four discussed Yang Wanli's approach of studying ZhouYi through history.
sentences.chinese: 第四部分论述了杨万里以史解易的诠释路向。

sentences.english: Members mapped out future plans for development at a brainstorming session.
sentences.chinese: 委员出席集思会，筹划房协未来的发展路向。

sentences.english: Your ship is on the way to Amazonia .
sentences.chinese: 你的船是就未来路向亚马逊。

sentences.english: Base fabric is bought from Guangzhou and is on the way.
sentences.chinese: 基地织物是买了从广州，是对未来路向。

sentences.english: Its basic thought road faces to talk it all namely for" return this open new".
sentences.chinese: 其基本思想路向概言之即为“返本开新”。

sentences.english: This road stretches northwards (for) hundreds of kilometres.
sentences.chinese: 这条路向北延伸数百英里。

sentences.english: To help shape students' future paths and set a goal of life ahead.
sentences.chinese: 引导学生明了自己的未来路向，及早订定人生目标。

sentences.english: Thee road runs northeast for another few miles.
sentences.chinese: 这条路向东北方又延伸了几英里。

definition: to go straight to/to make a beeline for
to make a detour/to go by way of
along/to follow (a line, tradition etc)/to carry on/to trim (a border with braid, tape etc)/border/edge
to turn back/to retrace one's steps
along the way/the duration of a journey
the whole journey/all the way/going the same way/going in the same direction/of the same kind
